name: Swaps
statement: You are given an array of integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \le a_i \le n$$$). You can perform the following operation several (possibly, zero) times: pick an arbitrary $$$i$$$ and perform swap $$$(a_i, a_{a_i})$$$. How many distinct arrays is it possible to attain? Output the answer modulo $$$(10^9 + 7)$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains an integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^6$$$). The second line contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n$$$ ($$$1\le a_i\le n$$$).
outputFormat: Output the number of attainable arrays modulo $$$(10^9 + 7)$$$.
